item.title: Bridging NetOps and CloudOps with Amazon VPC IPAM and Infoblox

item.title: Secure Global DNS resolution: Introducing Route 53 Global Resolver

item.title: re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - Solving private IPv4 exhaustion using AWS Cloud WAN and Amazon VPC Lattice
item.description: 4 February 2026 re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - Solving private IPv4 exhaustion using AWS Cloud WAN and Amazon VPC Lattice Hosts:Matt Lehwess Guests:Alexandra Huides, Pr. Solutions Architect Mehdi Dahan, Sr. Solutions Architect ðŸ“… Add to Calendar Abstract:Enterprises face private IPv4 exhaustion due to limited address planning, architectural shifts, mergers, and IP-hungry technologies like containers. The result - restrictions to cloud scalability and new project deployment. In this session, learn how AWS solutions solve these challenges with a scalable and cost effective approach combining AWS Cloud WAN with service insertion, and Amazon VPC Lattice to centralize private NAT Gateways and...

item.title: re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - I didn't know AWS WAF did this

Think again. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into creative, real-world use cases - from deploying honeypots and shedding traffic, to stopping account fraud and mitigating DDoS at scale. We'll explore advanced configurations, walk through customer-tested patterns, and whiteboard strategies that make WAF a powerful tool in your security arsenal. Bring your questions and experiences - we're here to break...

item.title: re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - Origin management for multi-region applications with Amazon CloudFront
item.description: 21 January 2026 re:Invent 2025 - Chalk Talk - Origin management for multi-region applications with Amazon CloudFront Hosts:Jamie Wenzel Guests:Vinicius Pedroni, Sr. Solutions Architect Jonathan Woods, Solutions Architect ðŸ“… Add to Calendar Abstract:In this session, you'll learn comprehensive origin management with Amazon CloudFront to build secure, resilient content delivery systems. We will cover automatic failover mechanisms with CloudFront and Route53, configure granular origin routing with CloudFront Functions, and secure origins using S3 with Origin Access Control (OAC) and VPC private origins for enhanced security. We'll explore integrating on-premises infrastructure through AWS Direct Connect for hybrid architectures, and deploy Origin Shield...

item.title: New Launch - Network Firewall Proxy Walkthrough
item.description: 10 December 2025 New Launch - Network Firewall Proxy Walkthrough Hosts:Tom Adamski Guests: ðŸ“… Add to Calendar Abstract:Join us for our final Twitch session of 2025, where weâ€™ll dive into the newly launched AWS Network Firewall Proxy. Weâ€™ll whiteboard, chat, and demo the feature to show how it enables centralized controls against data exfiltration and malware injection, with simple setup in explicit mode. Network Firewall Proxy helps you efficiently secure web and inter-network traffic by protecting against domain name and SNI spoofing, enforcing fine-grained access controls, and restricting application traffic to trusted domains or IPs while blocking unintended external responses....

item.title: Route 53 Resolver endpoint delegation
item.description:
15 October 2025
Route 53 Resolver endpoint delegation
Hosts:Tom Adamski Guests:Tekena Orugbani, Sr. Solutions Architect, AWS Adhish Bhobe, Sr. Product Manager, Route 53, AWS
ðŸ“… Add to Calendar
Abstract:A new capability of Route 53 Resolver endpoints, that helps customers make delegations for private hosted zone subdomains using Route 53 inbound and outbound Resolver endpoints. The feature allows customers to delegate the authority for a subdomain from their on-premises infrastructure to the Route 53 Resolver cloud service and vice versa, enabling a simplified cloud experience across namespaces in AWS and on their own local infrastructure.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

item.title: Modern Connectivity Patterns for ISVs on AWS

ðŸ“… Add to Calendar
Abstract:How do Independent Software Vendors build secure, scalable connectivity with their customers on AWS? In this session, weâ€™ll unpack common networking patterns ISVs use to expose their applications to end customers â€” and how they gain access to customer-owned data sources in the reverse direction. Weâ€™ll compare public connectivity approaches with private networking options, from VPC peering and Transit Gateway to application-centric services like AWS PrivateLink and Amazon VPC Lattice.
